Content: The numerator of a fraction is 1 more than the denominator. If the numerator and the denominator are both increased by 2_ the new fraction will be **one-eighth** more than the original fraction. Find the original fraction.
I got a complex solution but that does not seem right. Can someone double check?
the answer key had "3/2" and that doesn't work at all
And then someone else did it and got the same
